channel.title: S U S H A N T's
channel.description: Recent content on S U S H A N T's

item.title: Abstract Class in Go
item.description: What is an Abstract Class? An Abstract Class is the layout of the class. It defines several methods, some concrete and some abstract. The child class extending the abstract class needs to implement the abstract methods. It can also override the implementation of a concrete method. Why use Abstract Class? An abstract class is used when we want to provide a common interface for different implementations. But those multiple implementations have some methods in common which can be defined in the base class itself and used by all.

item.title: Why is Reading important?
item.description: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body. This is a famous quote by Richard Steele and it is 100% accurate. Think of it as trying to hold water in a dirty sieve. The water will definitely flow out from the pores but if you do it repeatedly, it will surely clean the sieve. The same holds with reading. The dirty sieve here is your mind and holding water is reading.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there, I am Sushant, a Software Engineer at Nutanix. I love problem solving and really enjoy writing code. I have 3+ years of experience working as software engineer. Here in Nutanix, I am working on ingestion of telemetry data. I am always open to new ideas and eager to learn new things. My current interests lies in distributed systems, how they work, their reliabilty and scalabilty. I also, though not often, take part in competitve programming.
